metadata.purpose: Standard Operating Procedures extracted from all sources

sales.name: MVA PI Sales 30-Minute Call Structure

phase_1_diagnose.objective: Let buyer demonstrate experience and self-qualify
questions: What states are you signing in?
What breaks down after the lead comes in?
Any vendors you've moved away from recently?
rules: Ask one open-ended question, then stop talking

phase_2_agitate.objective: Share real frustrations and identify leverage points
pain_points: Vendor burned for $60k, leads were garbage or recycled
Too many ghost leads with bad numbers
Internal team can't scale Google profitably

phase_3_match.objective: Build qualification criteria and align on CPA

phase_4_close.objective: Present the right pilot based on intake assessment
phase_4_close.capacity_check: Do you have capacity over the next 2-3 weeks?
phase_4_close.soft_close: Would you be opposed to starting with a small, capped pilot?

sales.key_principle: You are selling proof, not promises. The pilot is the close.

sales.name: Cold Call Script
sales.opener: Hey it's Mark Gundrum, you accepted my linkedin invite the other day, so I'm calling to introduce myself and see if there's any way we can help you.
sales.permission: It's a cold call you wanna hang up or tell you why I'm calling
sales.pitch: We specialize in MVA and work with a lot of PI firms to bring down their cost per signed case so they can scale, and we do that with exclusive leads and live transfers with a high close rate.
sales.qualifier: Is that something that aligns with your goals?

too_expensive.response: Compared to what — leads, transfers, or signed cases? The CPA math is different at each level.

need_to_think.objection: We need to think about it
need_to_think.response: Totally fair. Is it pricing, intake capacity, or which pilot tier fits best?

been_burned.response: That's why this is a one-time pilot, not a retainer. Capped pilots, clear criteria, no long-term commitments.

already_have_vendor.objection: We're already working with another vendor
already_have_vendor.response: What would make you add another source or replace a poor performer? Let's see if we can beat what you already have.

sales.name: 7-Day Appointment Booking Sequence
sales.stack: Meta Ads (Instant Forms) → Mailchimp + automation → SMS → Caller/Setter
sales.call_attempts: 3 attempts/day for 2 days, then 1/day to day 5

reddit_marketing.name: Reddit 10k Comments Domination SOP

step_1.name: Pick 5 money keywords
step_1.rule: If someone can imagine buying within 7 days, it's a money keyword

options.example: I've been using [Brand] and it's been solid…
link to a neutral resource page

step_4.name: Human Stack Comment Template
template: Line 1: empathy — 'I had the same problem…'
Line 2: mini story — 'Tried 2–3 options, wasted money/time…'
Line 3: recommendation (soft) — '[Brand] ended up being the easiest…'
Line 4: balanced comparison — 'If you just need X, tool A works. If you want Y, this is better…'
Line 5: exit line (anti-shill) — 'not sponsored, just what worked for me'
style_rules: don't sound like a landing page

step_5.name: Conversation Stack for top 3 ranking
step_5.variety: Make each reply feel like different person

reddit_marketing.kpi: Top 3 comments in threads that rank on Google = compounding traffic

reddit_marketing.name: Reddit Account Warmup
key_rules: Try not to link to your brand name

ai_seo.name: ChatGPT Citation Strategy
ai_seo.key_rule: Publish on parasite sites, NOT own brand site (avoid self-shilling)

critical_tactics.reddit: Reddit is #2 source for AI Overview citations. You don't need to rank - just being in thread gets crawled.
critical_tactics.youtube: YouTube is #1 source. Pages with YouTube embeds can rank even at positions 10-20.
critical_tactics.browserblast: Simulates virality with 10k sessions. Works best for low-traffic sites.
critical_tactics.press_releases: AB Newswire $80/release. Helps AI Overviews for first 2-3 days.

ai_seo.name: Agent-Complete Optimization
ai_seo.principle: AI tools decide who to recommend based on: what they can read, whether they trust it, whether they can actually buy from you
checklist: Make website 'agent-complete' (test form submissions, calculator flows)
Ensure service info matches everywhere (page, schema, GBP, directories)
Add Q&A section to every service page (5-10 questions with FAQ schema)
Show proof humans trust you (reviews with schema, case results)
Describe images/videos properly (detailed alt text, transcripts)

lead_gen.name: Meta Ads Lead Generation Funnel
lead_gen.flow: Meta Ads → Landing Page (8-12% conversion) → Multi-step form → Auto-qualification → GHL webhook → Intake/follow-up → Booked call → Sales call → Signed case

steps.focus: Quick partnership question + key stats (100+ leads in 90 days, ~$2k per case)
Speed: 'Can usually start sending leads within 7 days'
Value prop: 'Most firms care about cost per signed case. Ours averages ~$2k.'
Timing: 'When is the best time to call you?'
Close the loop: 'Even a not right now helps'

automation.name: Phone Farm with Cloud Phones
use_cases: Add to carts + wishlist on Amazon

marketing.trackings_ai: Monitor ChatGPT + Google AI Overviews citations (free tier)
